author: Nation World News Desk
title: INAPAM: These Elders Will Be Able To Learn English For Free
text: Written on 7/1/2024 · 10:00 am in National. National Institute for the People older adults ,Inapam) is most recognized for the credential that provides them with various discounts, however, this organization is also in charge of other activities such as organizing classes. English And other languages. It is through the cultural centers of Inapam That more than 150 activities are taught to the students older adultsOf which there are four and distributed in different parts of Mexico City. It should be noted that different activities are provided for each of them older adultslike the classes of EnglishFrench, ballroom dancing, embroidery and fabric printing, yoga, Zumba and even guidance on apps, cell phones and tablets. To reach them, older adults They must meet these requirements: - be 60 years or older - official id - Credential of Inapam - Specific Population Registry Code (CURP) - two child sized photos - medical certificate - Registration format in cultural centers Inapam - collection fee Benefits offered by INAPAM to older adults He Inapam It is the body in charge of security older adults, because it is one of the most vulnerable groups in the society. Efforts are made to ensure that the elderly receive better care through a range of support and social programs. One of the programs that stands out among the programs designed for older adults InapamWith this, all senior citizens get access to sales and discounts at various participating establishments. To know them all, you can enter the 2023 Benefits Directory with a credential InapamWhich can be accessed through the official website of the Government of Mexico. JR

author: cnicholson@local3news.com (Cornelia Nicholson)
title: Manage credit card debt with a 0% balance transfer
text:
We've made it past the holidays, but now you might be dealing with a credit card debt hangover from purchasing all of those gifts. With interest rates soaring, a credit card balance transfer to a new card with a lower interest rate could be a solution to tackling your debt this year. It's a move
Bankrate found 37% of people in debt aren't aware of.
Jasmine Johnson, a Credit and Financial Counselor and Entertainment Accountant for Square One Accounting, said a balance transfer is a simple process of moving your credit card debt to a new card with zero interest for a promotional period. The main benefit is lowering the interest you're paying on your credit card debt.
"You can pay a one time, in this instance, let's say a 4% fee. A $200 fee on a $5,000 balance. That $200 dollars as opposed to $1,100 in interest, you can get that balance paid off rather quickly if you go that route," explained Johnson.
While a balance transfer is an easy process there are five things you'll want to consider before signing up for that new card you got in the mail to make sure it's right for you.
First, Johnson said it's important that you take a look at your budget.
Before you can eliminate your debt, you need to know where you stand.
The two main things to look at is how much debt you owe and the amount you can afford to put toward your debt each month.
"Do the math before you do that balance transfer because you can easily put yourself back in the same situation if the math is not done prior to getting it."
Second, you'll also want to check your credit score.
Knowing your score can help you determine what type of balance transfer card you can qualify for or if you need to improve your score before applying.
There are many services that offer a free check of your credit score without affecting the score, like
Credit Karma and Experian.
Many balance transfer credit cards require good-to-excellent credit to get approval, or a credit score of at least 670.
"So, someone with bad credit, I would definitely say contact the creditor directly. It's okay to ask for help, right? Asking if they have any hardship programs, or any other relief like lowering their minimal payment," said Johnson.
Third, once you've crunched the numbers, then it's time to shop around for different cards to find which one will best suit your needs.
Some credit cards will offer longer 0% interest rate periods while others might have better long term rewards.
Johnson said you should check with your current bank, local credit unions and major reputable credit companies.
"If you're getting those offers in the mail, definitely open them up to at least see what they have to say. At least you're not under a lot of pressure, you can sit at your counter and say okay this is what they're offering."
Fourth, it's important to note that not all balance transfers are free.
Check to see if the card charges for a balance transfer or requires an annual fee.
"You don't want to get a credit card that is then adding more fees that you have to take care of," added Johnson.
Once you've found a card that fits your budget and goals, there's typically a long sheet that the credit company wants you to read.
The fifth thing you need to do is read the fine print.
"In there they'll tell you if you miss a payment they are going to void out the agreement that you all have... It's good to read the fine print, those are things that could be hidden in there."
Johnson adds you should also have a plan figured out in case you aren't approved for the full amount or denied completely.
"There's nothing wrong with asking for help, asking from friends too. If you have a plan and go to a friend and say 'hey, here's my plan on how I'll pay you back,' that's okay too. There's other 0% APR with friends too."
A balance transfer could help you save hundreds of dollars, but make sure it's right for you. To see if it'll work for you, you should crunch the numbers in a credit card payoff calculator.
To use a payoff calculator,
click here.

author: IANS
title: VST Industries hits upper circuit of 20% after Radha Kishan Damani, MFs buy shares - Investing.com India
text:
New Delhi, Jan 2 (IANS) Shares of VST Industries (NS: VSTI ) ended at the upper circuit of 20 per cent on Tuesday after investor Radha Kishan Damani and three mutual funds acquired shares in bulk deals from the market.Damani bought 2.22 lakh shares at a price of Rs 3,390. Mutual funds, including SBI (NS: SBI ) Mutual Fund, bought 2.25 lakh shares, DSP Mutual Fund bought 2.5 lakh shares, while HDFC Mutual Fund bought 2 lakh shares in bulk deals.
VST Industries hit the upper circuit of 20 per cent at Rs 4,065 on the BSE, touching a 52-week high. Its market capitalisation is Rs 6,277 crore.
VST Industries had disclosed in December that the Central Pollution Control Board passed a show-cause notice for non-compliance of the Plastic Waste Management (NYSE: WM ) Rules, 2016.
The show-cause notice alleges violation of Rule 4(h) and 10(3) of the Plastic Waste Management Rules, 2016 under the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986.
The financial impact of the show-cause notice cannot be ascertained at the moment. The notice is open for submission before the relevant authorities.
The company does not agree with the notice and will take appropriate action by filing a reply and contesting the matter, VST Industries had said.
The Vazir Sultan Tobacco Company Limited was incorporated on November 10, 1930, under the Hyderabad Companies Act. It is now governed under the Companies Act, 1956/2013. The name of the company was subsequently changed to VST Industries Limited on April 30, 1983. The company has its registered office at Azamabad in Hyderabad.
The company has manufacturing facilities in Hyderabad and Toopran (Telangana) and its principal activities are manufacturing and sales of cigarettes and unmanufactured tobacco.
(Sanjeev Sharma can be reached at Sanjeev.s@ians.in)
--IANS
san/arm

author: Zacks
title: Kratos (KTOS) Wins $50M Deal for CUAS & Air Defense Systems
text:
Kratos Defense & Security Solutions, Inc.
[KTOS](/market-activity/stocks/ktos) recently secured a $50 million contract for Products and Hardware to develop and support Counter Unmanned Aerial Systems (CUAS), Air Defense and Radar Systems.
The work related to these awards will be conducted at secure Kratos manufacturing facilities and various customer locations.
What’s Ahead?
Increasing geopolitical tensions worldwide have prompted nations to strengthen their defense systems manifold. With rapid technological upgrades, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV) have steadily become pivotal in a nation’s defense strategy. This tends to benefit Kratos as it has expertise in manufacturing UAVs for military missions. The company has been offering high-quality defense products and has won many relevant orders.
Due to an upsurge in military spending and demand for improved surveillance solutions, we may expect the UAV market to show impressive growth. In this context, per the report from by Mordor Intelligence, the UAV market is estimated at $17.31 billion in 2024 and is expected to reach $32.95 billion by 2029, at a CAGR of 13.74% during 2024-2029.
This reflects expanding market opportunities for companies like Kratos that enjoy a well-established position in the UAV market. Other defense majors that may benefit from the increasing demand for UAVs are as follows:
RTX Corp.
[RTX](/market-activity/stocks/rtx): The Coyote Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) is equipped with an advanced seeker and warhead that can successfully identify and eliminate threat UAVs. It is ideal for improved surveillance imagery, enhanced targeting capability, near real-time damage assessment and reduced threat to manned aircraft. The U.S. Army has selected the Coyote drone for a near-term counter-UAS solution.
RTX boasts a long-term (three-to five-years) earnings growth rate of 9.4%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2024 sales implies an improvement of 5.9% from the previous year's estimated figure.
Lockheed Martin
[LMT](/market-activity/stocks/lmt): The company has a vast portfolio of autonomous systems, including Indago 4, MORFIUS, Stalker UAS etc. LMT’s business unit Sikorsky’s MATRIX technology is an aircraft autonomy system that will one day enable helicopters to resupply forward forces on the future battlefield without any human pilots or crew on board.
LMT boasts a long-term earnings growth rate of 7.9%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2024 sales implies an improvement of 2.9% from the previous year's estimated figure.
Northrop Grumman
[NOC](/market-activity/stocks/noc): It is a leader in autonomous systems and offers an impressive portfolio of UAVs, which include Global Hawk, MQ-4C Triton, Fire Scout, Bat UAS etc. In November 2023, Australia’s multi-intelligence MQ-4C Triton completed its first flight. Australia has placed an order for four such UAS.
NOC boasts a long-term earnings growth rate of 2.3%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2024 sales implies an improvement of 5% from the previous year's estimated figure.
Price Performance
In the past year, shares of KTOS have rallied 76.6% compared with the
industry’s 25.9% rise.
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research
Zacks Rank
Kratos currently has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can see
the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.

author: , Journal Sentinel
title: Waterford's Hayden Halter has 2019 wrestling title reinstated by court
text: [Zac Bellman](/staff/5378002001/zac-bellman/) Waterford wrestler Hayden Halter had his 2019 WIAA state individual wrestling title reinstated by a Wisconsin Court of Appeals ruling Wednesday, the latest turn in a multi-year legal battle. The Court of Appeals stated that the WIAA "applied its eligibility and appeals rules with respect to Halter in a manner that was arbitrary and in accordance with its will and not its judgment" in a ruling in favor of Halter. Here are the developments of the case, which began with two penalties assessed five years ago: Halter initially suspended for two unsportsmanlike penalties In the Southern Lakes Conference tournament on Feb. 2, 2019, Halter received two unsportsmanlike penalties – the validity of which has been the subject of significant scrutiny – in a victory by decision. The first was levied on the sophomore for questioning an official's call. The latter came for flexing his muscles and shouting at an opposing crowd from Burlington, where Halter was enrolled and wrestled as a freshman. Journal Sentinel reporting at the time stated that the official involved, Michael Arendt, claimed Halter responded to a call at the end of the match with profanity before making the flexing gesture to the crowd. WIAA rules mandated a one-match suspension for Halter for the assessed infractions, which would have made him ineligible for the regional tournament that followed and ended his season. Halter won initial injuction to allow him to compete in 2019 The Halter family retained a lawyer and took the case to the Racine County Circuit Court, where a judge ruled on Feb. 8, 2019, that Halter's actions did not merit the two unsportsmanlike penalties. A restraining order was issued to block the suspension, allowing Halter to continue to compete in the WIAA postseason. Halter went on to win the WIAA Division 1 state individual title at 120 pounds, his second-consecutive title after winning at 106 pounds as a freshman at Burlington. The crowd at the Kohl Center for the 2019 state tournament was apparently well aware of the controversy around Halter's eligibility as he ascended to the title, as a [chorus of boo's rang down](/story/sports/high-schools/2019/02/22/wiaa-state-wrestling-hayden-halter-booed-kohl-center-crowd/2959009002/) on his final wins to secure the title. Circuit Court appeal ruling strips state title The WIAA appealed the Circuit Court ruling, and after a May 2021 evidentiary hearing, received a ruling in its favor. Motions made on behalf of the Halters for certiorari (appeal to a higher court), a declaratory judgment and a permanent injunction were denied according to court documents. The Circuit Court ruled that the WIAA's interpretation of its rules initially was "in accord with a long-standing policy of the WIAA" and "did not violate Halter’s procedural or substantive due process rights." The judgement stripped Halter of his 2019 individual state title, as well as all matches, places, points and scores from the regional tournament through the end of the season. The Halters appealed the decision, leading to Wednesday's ruling. Wednesday's ruling reinstates 2019 title The Circuit Court of Appeals ruling Wednesday included a declaration that Halter's registration and sitting out of a Badger Invitational junior varsity/varsity reserve meet held on Feb. 5, 2019, between the Feb. 2 conference meet and the Feb. 9 regional meet, satisfied the serving of his suspension. Furthermore, the court stated that Halter was thus eligible to compete and receive all titles, wins and points awarded to him and his team, including related records and benefits. "This court further concludes that Halter is entitled to a permanent injunction reinstating his 2019 WIAA Division I state wrestling title, as well as all wins and points (to him and to his team) and all accompanying records and benefits therefrom," the ruling stated. In a statement Thursday, the WIAA did not rule out the possibility of an appeal to the Wisconsin Supreme Court. "The WIAA is reviewing the Court of Appeals’ decision with its legal counsel and considering the next steps in the process," the statement read. As of Thursday afternoon, the WIAA accounting of all-time individual state title winners lists the 2019 Division 1 120-pound title as "Vacated by ineligible wrestler." Halter, meanwhile, describes himself as a "2x D1 Wisconsin State Champion" on his Instagram profile .

author: Redazione
title: Sulle serrande di “Pro Vita” appare la natività di Laika: è contro “il patriarcato”
text:
[Attualità](/attualita/) [Esquilino](/notizie/esquilino/)/ Viale Manzoni
Sulle serrande di “Pro Vita” appare la natività di Laika: è contro “il patriarcato”
Murales provocatori della street artist con dedica a Michela Murgia: "Diceva che la famiglia sono le persone che ti scegli"
A viale Manzoni sono stati realizzati due murales. Li ha disegnati la street artist Laika in uno spazio non certo casuale: sono stati infatti dipinti sulle serrande della
sede di ProVita e Famiglia.
Cosa raffigurano le due opere
Le opere, che sono due, reinterpretano la natività. Realizzate il giorno della vigilia di Natale, raffigurano nel primo caso due Madonne che coccolono il bambino Gesù, avvolto da un lenzuolo arcobaleno, a richiamare la bandiera del movimento Lgbtq+. L’altro invece mostra San Giuseppe, nei panni del falegname, che realizza una bara. Sopra la cassa di legno si legge “patriarcato”.
I valori tradizionali ed il patriarcato
“Questo è il mio augurio di buon Natale a tutti gli italiani - ha dichiarato Laika -, che sia di buon auspicio per il futuro: un futuro senza discriminazioni, che si lascia alle spalle i cosiddetti 'valori tradizionali', frutto di una società misogina, omofoba e patriarcale. Di quel patriarcato che ancora oggi è responsabile della morte di una donna ogni tre giorni per mano di un uomo”.
Le ultime opere di Laika
L'opera è dedicata a Michela Murgia, che sulla famiglia diceva: “La famiglia sono le persone che ti scegli” è stato spiegato da Laika. L'artista a Roma, negli ultimi anni, si è contraddistinta per una serie di opere provocatorie. Il 25 aprile, in occasione della Liberazione, aveva realizzato un manifesto in cui rappresentava
un'anziana partigiana che inseguiva, con il mattarello, il presidente del senato Ignazio La Russa, protagonista in estate di un'altra opera, questa volta con la ministra Daniela Santanché.
L'indice puntato contro le associazioni Pro Vita e Famiglia
“La cornice – ha inoltre sottolineato la street artist – non è casuale: è assurdo che nel 2023 ci siano associazioni sponsorizzate e finanziate dallo stato che promuovano valori medievali, come l'ascolto del battito cardiaco del feto e la cancellazione di un* dei due genitori dai certificati di nascita di famiglie gay. Ognuno ha diritto a fare la proprie scelte riguardo il proprio corpo e il proprio orientamento sessuale”.
